Articles.Content:
OK! so!

I really want to show my brother how KSP works and how awesome the game is, problem is, the demo sucks ((This is only my opinion!) the full games great though), Would it be OK for me to give him a copy of my game so he can play around with it a bit and if he likes it he can buy the full game?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-11T20:46:33Z" title="04/11/2015 08:46  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 11, 2015</time> by Rainbowtrout**
  
clearing up some language :)

> 
> probably not

I thought the same myself but It's worth a shot (waiting for a mod/admin/some official to reply before i do anything).

Eeeeeh, not supposed to, you can show him your game and he can play it on your PC, that's fine, but yeah the current demo sucks a bit, though a new one is planned.

If you let him have short doses of KSP he'll beg for more, you could tell him you'll buy him a copy if he cleans your car or something ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

What's stopping you from inviting your brother to try it out at your place. Or take your laptop (with KSP) with you when you visit him?

Edit: Mod ninja'd
If you want to show him teh awesomeness but have concerns about violating distribution terms, then give him the free demo and some forum links to outstanding spacecraft images/Mission Reports.

Thank ya'll for answering my question. I'll see if he will try it out on my pc for a bit and if he likes it I might pitch in for a copy that he can have ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
